intro: Messerschmidia umbellata, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Messerschmidia umbellata is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
